result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin B McFeely was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with victims family or co-defendants.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges, joint and several with co-defendants. (if not paid during probation period)

$250 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.  (if not paid during probation period)

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges, joint and several with co-defendants.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with victims family or co-defendants.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 60 days stayed, to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. To commence forthwith.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alvin B McFeely in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Alvin B McFeely in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Atty Korb & Atty Reetz makes sentencing statements.  Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Alvin B McFeely in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Alvin B McFeely in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Alvin B McFeely in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Alvin B McFeely in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond set.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:00 am.
